H0.text: The nervous system is the body system responsible for breaking down the pasta into small nutrients for use in the cells of the runners, after the runners ate pasta before a race and the pasta was broken down into simple sugars absorbed by the bloodstream.

H1.text: The digestive system is responsible for breaking down pasta into small nutrients for use in the runners' cells after the pasta is converted into simple sugars and absorbed into the bloodstream.

H2.text: The excretory system is responsible for breaking down the pasta into simple sugars, which are absorbed by the bloodstream for use in the cells of the runners.

H3.text: The endocrine system is the body system responsible for breaking down the pasta into simple sugars that were absorbed into the bloodstream and used by the cells of the runners who ate it before a race.

A4.text: Most of the digestion of food takes place in the small intestine.

A5.text: The circular folds also slow the passage of food giving more time for nutrients to be absorbed.
